name: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
instructions: Boil spaghetti in salted water until al dente and drain. In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté finely sliced garlic until golden. Add chili flakes and cook for a few seconds. Toss in the drained spaghetti and mix well to coat. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot.

name: Peanut Butter Banana Smoothie
instructions: Peel and slice the banana. Add banana, peanut butter, milk, honey, and ice cubes to a blender. Blend until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Pour into a glass and serve chilled immediately.

name: Masala Chai
instructions: Crush ginger and cardamom pods. Boil water and add the spices. Let simmer for 2-3 minutes. Add tea leaves, then milk and sugar. Simmer, strain into cups, and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Maggi
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, sauté mixed vegetables for a couple of minutes. Add water and Maggi tastemaker. Bring to a boil, add noodles, and cook until done. Serve hot.

name: Fruit Salad
instructions: Chop all fruits into bite-sized pieces. In a bowl, mix fruits with honey and a splash of lemon juice. Toss gently and serve fresh or chilled.

name: Omelette
instructions: Beat eggs with chopped onion, tomato, chilies, salt, and pepper. Heat oil in a pan, pour the mixture, spread evenly. Cook both sides until golden. Serve hot.

name: Paneer Bhurji
instructions: Sauté onions in oil until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste, then tomatoes and spices. Crumble paneer into the mix, stir, and cook for 5 minutes. Garnish with coriander and serve.

name: Lemon Rice
instructions: Heat oil, crackle mustard seeds, add curry leaves and chilies. Add turmeric and salt. Mix in cooked rice and lemon juice. Stir well and serve warm.

name: Chocolate Mug Cake
instructions: In a mug, mix flour, cocoa, sugar, and baking powder. Add milk and oil. Mix to a smooth batter. Microwave for 1-2 minutes. Let cool slightly before eating.

name: Curd Rice
instructions: Mix cooked rice with curd and salt. Temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, chopped ginger and chilies in oil. Add to rice, mix gently. Serve chilled or room temp.

name: Aloo Paratha
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes. Mix with chopped chilies, coriander, and spices. Make dough with wheat flour. Stuff dough with filling, roll and cook on a hot tawa with oil until golden on both sides.

name: Poha
instructions: Wash poha and drain. Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, and onion. Add turmeric and salt. Mix in poha and cook for 2 minutes. Add lemon juice and serve hot.

name: Chole
instructions: Soak and boil chickpeas. Sauté onions, add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and chole masala. Add chickpeas and simmer for 15 minutes. Garnish with coriander and serve.

name: Besan Chilla
instructions: Make a batter of gram flour, chopped veggies, salt, and water. Pour onto a hot greased pan, spread into a thin pancake. Cook both sides until golden. Serve hot.

name: Vegetable Pulao
instructions: Sauté cumin and bay leaf in oil. Add chopped veggies and sauté. Add rinsed rice and water. Season with salt. Cover and cook until rice is fluffy. Serve with raita.

name: Banana Pancakes
instructions: Mash banana and mix with flour, sugar, baking powder, and milk. Make a smooth batter. Pour on a hot greased pan and cook both sides until golden. Serve with syrup.

name: Sooji Halwa
instructions: Roast semolina in ghee until golden. Boil sugar and water separately. Add sugar syrup to semolina and stir constantly. Add cardamom and fried cashews. Serve warm.

name: Tomato Soup
instructions: Sauté onions and garlic in butter. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Blend the mixture, strain, and simmer. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

name: Rava Upma
instructions: Roast semolina and keep aside. Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, chilies, and onions. Add water and salt. Bring to a boil, add semolina, stir continuously until thick. Serve hot.

name: Egg Fried Rice
instructions: Scramble eggs in oil and set aside. Sauté onions, add cooked rice, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Add scrambled eggs back in and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Serve hot.
